org.jpws.pwslib.data

Class ContextFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpws.pwslib.data.ContextFile

  • public class ContextFile
extends java.lang.Object
    A ContextFile is the combination of ApplicationAdapter and a filepath. This two-tuple is meant to define an unequivocal file in the context of a program using the PWSLIB, giving the freedom to abstract from different resource media. Abbreviated constructors are available for the local file system and the system's standard application adapter, for the case this should be different.

    A ContextFile always has meaningful settings for adapter and filepath. These values cannot be modified after creation of an instance.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ContextFile(ApplicationAdapter adapter, java.lang.String filepath)
      Creates a context file with the given IO-context and file name.
      ContextFile(java.io.File file)
      Creates a context file from the local file system.
      ContextFile(java.lang.String filepath)
      Creates a context file from the system's standard application adapter.

        Parameters:
        filepath - String file path

      • refresh

        public void refresh()
             throws java.io.IOException

        java.io.IOException

      • delete

        public boolean delete()
               throws java.io.IOException
        Attempts to delete the persistent state of this context file on the external file system.
        Returns:
        boolean true if and only if the file does not exist after termination of this method
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • renameTo

        public boolean renameTo(java.lang.String newpath)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Attempts to rename this file to the given path expression on the external medium. If the file does not exist or this operation is not permitted, false is returned. The file path of this file does not change by this operation!

        The moving of this file to a different location may also be triggered by this method, if this operation is supported by the external file system.

        Parameters:
        newpath - String new identifier of this file on external file system
        Returns:
        boolean true if and only if the operation was successful
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • exists

               throws java.io.IOException
        Whether this file has a persistent state on the external medium.
        Returns:
        boolean true if and only if the file exists external
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        ATTENTION!! - This overwrites any previous content of the file!!
        Parameters:
